intro: Cota nigellifolia, commonly known as black cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its seeds are rich in essential oils. The leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for their digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy perennial in temperate climates.
